article.title: Characterisation of Optimal Responses to Pulse Inputs in the Bergman Minimal Model

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following statements is true about the glucose responses shown in Figure 1?
choices: Both responses have the same maximum glucose concentration.
The response corresponding to injection time t<sub>1</sub> (brown) has a lower maximum glucose concentration.
The response corresponding to injection time t<sub>2</sub> (blue) has a lower maximum glucose concentration, while still maintaining the glucose concentration above the specified minimum.
The timing of the pulse input does not affect the maximum glucose concentration.
The effect of different basal input rates on glucose concentration.
The existence of a glucose response with a lower maximum concentration (g<sub>2</sub>) compared to another response (g<sub>1</sub>) while still maintaining the minimum glucose concentration.
The impact of meal intake on glucose concentration over time.
The relationship between insulin effectiveness and glucose uptake.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the significance of the input time 445 shown in Figure 3?
choices: It represents the time at which the maximum glucose concentration reaches its highest possible value.
It is the time at which the bolus input is completely absorbed.
It is the optimal injection time that minimizes the maximum glucose concentration (γ) for the given input function w(t).
It indicates the time at which the minimum glucose concentration (λ) is achieved.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the formula Û(λ) represent?
choices: The minimum glucose concentration achievable with a given insulin bolus.
An upper bound on the magnitude (û) of the bolus input required to achieve a specified minimum glucose concentration (λ).
The optimal delivery time (t\') for the insulin bolus.
